00019 #include "kernel_differential.h"

00037 
00038 typedef struct PathState {
00039     uint flag;
00040     int bounce;
00041 
00042     int diffuse_bounce;
00043     int glossy_bounce;
00044     int transmission_bounce;
00045     int transparent_bounce;
00046 } PathState;
00047 
00048 __device_inline void path_state_init(PathState *state)
00049 {
00050     state->flag = PATH_RAY_CAMERA|PATH_RAY_SINGULAR|PATH_RAY_MIS_SKIP;
00051     state->bounce = 0;
00052     state->diffuse_bounce = 0;
00053     state->glossy_bounce = 0;
00054     state->transmission_bounce = 0;
00055     state->transparent_bounce = 0;
00056 }
00057 
00058 __device_inline void path_state_next(KernelGlobals *kg, PathState *state, int label)
00059 {
00060     /* ray through transparent keeps same flags from previous ray and is
00061        not counted as a regular bounce, transparent has separate max */
00062     if(label & LABEL_TRANSPARENT) {
00063         state->flag |= PATH_RAY_TRANSPARENT;
00064         state->transparent_bounce++;
00065 
00066         if(!kernel_data.integrator.transparent_shadows)
00067             state->flag |= PATH_RAY_MIS_SKIP;
00068 
00069         return;
00070     }
00071 
00072     state->bounce++;
00073 
00074     /* reflection/transmission */
00075     if(label & LABEL_REFLECT) {
00076         state->flag |= PATH_RAY_REFLECT;
00077         state->flag &= ~(PATH_RAY_TRANSMIT|PATH_RAY_CAMERA|PATH_RAY_TRANSPARENT);
00078 
00079         if(label & LABEL_DIFFUSE)
00080             state->diffuse_bounce++;
00081         else
00082             state->glossy_bounce++;
00083     }
00084     else {
00085         kernel_assert(label & LABEL_TRANSMIT);
00086 
00087         state->flag |= PATH_RAY_TRANSMIT;
00088         state->flag &= ~(PATH_RAY_REFLECT|PATH_RAY_CAMERA|PATH_RAY_TRANSPARENT);
00089 
00090         state->transmission_bounce++;
00091     }
00092 
00093     /* diffuse/glossy/singular */
00094     if(label & LABEL_DIFFUSE) {
00095         state->flag |= PATH_RAY_DIFFUSE;
00096         state->flag &= ~(PATH_RAY_GLOSSY|PATH_RAY_SINGULAR|PATH_RAY_MIS_SKIP);
00097     }
00098     else if(label & LABEL_GLOSSY) {
00099         state->flag |= PATH_RAY_GLOSSY;
00100         state->flag &= ~(PATH_RAY_DIFFUSE|PATH_RAY_SINGULAR|PATH_RAY_MIS_SKIP);
00101     }
00102     else {
00103         kernel_assert(label & LABEL_SINGULAR);
00104 
00105         state->flag |= PATH_RAY_GLOSSY|PATH_RAY_SINGULAR|PATH_RAY_MIS_SKIP;
00106         state->flag &= ~PATH_RAY_DIFFUSE;
00107     }
00108 }
00109 
00110 __device_inline uint path_state_ray_visibility(KernelGlobals *kg, PathState *state)
00111 {
00112     uint flag = state->flag;
00113 
00114     /* for visibility, diffuse/glossy are for reflection only */
00115     if(flag & PATH_RAY_TRANSMIT)
00116         flag &= ~(PATH_RAY_DIFFUSE|PATH_RAY_GLOSSY);
00117     /* for camera visibility, use render layer flags */
00118     if(flag & PATH_RAY_CAMERA)
00119         flag |= kernel_data.integrator.layer_flag;
00120 
00121     return flag;
00122 }
00123 
00124 __device_inline float path_state_terminate_probability(KernelGlobals *kg, PathState *state, const float3 throughput)
00125 {
00126     if(state->flag & PATH_RAY_TRANSPARENT) {
00127         /* transparent rays treated separately */
00128         if(state->transparent_bounce >= kernel_data.integrator.transparent_max_bounce)
00129             return 0.0f;
00130         else if(state->transparent_bounce <= kernel_data.integrator.transparent_min_bounce)
00131             return 1.0f;
00132     }
00133     else {
00134         /* other rays */
00135         if((state->bounce >= kernel_data.integrator.max_bounce) ||
00136            (state->diffuse_bounce >= kernel_data.integrator.max_diffuse_bounce) ||
00137            (state->glossy_bounce >= kernel_data.integrator.max_glossy_bounce) ||
00138            (state->transmission_bounce >= kernel_data.integrator.max_transmission_bounce))
00139             return 0.0f;
00140         else if(state->bounce <= kernel_data.integrator.min_bounce)
00141             return 1.0f;
00142     }
00143 
00144     /* probalistic termination */
00145     return average(throughput);
00146 }
00147 
00148 __device_inline bool shadow_blocked(KernelGlobals *kg, PathState *state, Ray *ray, float3 *shadow)
00149 {
00150     *shadow = make_float3(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f);
00151 
00152     if(ray->t == 0.0f)
00153         return false;
00154     
00155     Intersection isect;
00156     bool result = scene_intersect(kg, ray, PATH_RAY_SHADOW_OPAQUE, &isect);
00157 
00158 #ifdef __TRANSPARENT_SHADOWS__
00159     if(result && kernel_data.integrator.transparent_shadows) {
00160         /* transparent shadows work in such a way to try to minimize overhead
00161            in cases where we don't need them. after a regular shadow ray is
00162            cast we check if the hit primitive was potentially transparent, and
00163            only in that case start marching. this gives on extra ray cast for
00164            the cases were we do want transparency.
00165            
00166            also note that for this to work correct, multi close sampling must
00167            be used, since we don't pass a random number to shader_eval_surface */
00168         if(shader_transparent_shadow(kg, &isect)) {
00169             float3 throughput = make_float3(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f);
00170             float3 Pend = ray->P + ray->D*ray->t;
00171             int bounce = state->transparent_bounce;
00172 
00173             for(;;) {
00174                 if(bounce >= kernel_data.integrator.transparent_max_bounce) {
00175                     return true;
00176                 }
00177                 else if(bounce >= kernel_data.integrator.transparent_min_bounce) {
00178                     /* todo: get random number somewhere for probabilistic terminate */
00179 #if 0
00180                     float probability = average(throughput);
00181                     float terminate = 0.0f;
00182 
00183                     if(terminate >= probability)
00184                         return true;
00185 
00186                     throughput /= probability;
00187 #endif
00188                 }
00189 
00190                 if(!scene_intersect(kg, ray, PATH_RAY_SHADOW_TRANSPARENT, &isect)) {
00191                     *shadow *= throughput;
00192                     return false;
00193                 }
00194 
00195                 if(!shader_transparent_shadow(kg, &isect))
00196                     return true;
00197 
00198                 ShaderData sd;
00199                 shader_setup_from_ray(kg, &sd, &isect, ray);
00200                 shader_eval_surface(kg, &sd, 0.0f, PATH_RAY_SHADOW);
00201 
00202                 throughput *= shader_bsdf_transparency(kg, &sd);
00203 
00204                 ray->P = ray_offset(sd.P, -sd.Ng);
00205                 if(ray->t != FLT_MAX)
00206                     ray->D = normalize_len(Pend - ray->P, &ray->t);
00207 
00208                 bounce++;
00209             }
00210         }
00211     }
00212 #endif
00213 
00214     return result;
00215 }
00216 
00217 __device float4 kernel_path_integrate(KernelGlobals *kg, RNG *rng, int sample, Ray ray, __global float *buffer)
00218 {
00219     /* initialize */
00220     PathRadiance L;
00221     float3 throughput = make_float3(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f);
00222     float L_transparent = 0.0f;
00223 
00224     path_radiance_init(&L, kernel_data.film.use_light_pass);
00225 
00226     float ray_pdf = 0.0f;
00227     PathState state;
00228     int rng_offset = PRNG_BASE_NUM;
00229 
00230     path_state_init(&state);
00231 
00232     /* path iteration */
00233     for(;; rng_offset += PRNG_BOUNCE_NUM) {
00234         /* intersect scene */
00235         Intersection isect;
00236         uint visibility = path_state_ray_visibility(kg, &state);
00237 
00238         if(!scene_intersect(kg, &ray, visibility, &isect)) {
00239             /* eval background shader if nothing hit */
00240             if(kernel_data.background.transparent && (state.flag & PATH_RAY_CAMERA)) {
00241                 L_transparent += average(throughput);
00242             }
00243 #ifdef __BACKGROUND__
00244             else {
00245                 /* sample background shader */
00246                 float3 L_background = indirect_background(kg, &ray, state.flag, ray_pdf);
00247                 path_radiance_accum_background(&L, throughput, L_background, state.bounce);
00248             }
00249 #endif
00250 
00251             break;
00252         }
00253 
00254         /* setup shading */
00255         ShaderData sd;
00256         shader_setup_from_ray(kg, &sd, &isect, &ray);
00257         float rbsdf = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_BSDF);
00258         shader_eval_surface(kg, &sd, rbsdf, state.flag);
00259 
00260         kernel_write_data_passes(kg, buffer, &L, &sd, sample, state.flag, throughput);
00261 
00262 #ifdef __HOLDOUT__
00263         if((sd.flag & SD_HOLDOUT) && (state.flag & PATH_RAY_CAMERA)) {
00264             float3 holdout_weight = shader_holdout_eval(kg, &sd);
00265 
00266             if(kernel_data.background.transparent)
00267                 /* any throughput is ok, should all be identical here */
00268                 L_transparent += average(holdout_weight*throughput);
00269         }
00270 #endif
00271 
00272 #ifdef __EMISSION__
00273         /* emission */
00274         if(sd.flag & SD_EMISSION) {
00275             float3 emission = indirect_emission(kg, &sd, isect.t, state.flag, ray_pdf);
00276             path_radiance_accum_emission(&L, throughput, emission, state.bounce);
00277         }
00278 #endif
00279 
00280         /* path termination. this is a strange place to put the termination, it's
00281            mainly due to the mixed in MIS that we use. gives too many unneeded
00282            shader evaluations, only need emission if we are going to terminate */
00283         float probability = path_state_terminate_probability(kg, &state, throughput);
00284         float terminate = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_TERMINATE);
00285 
00286         if(terminate >= probability)
00287             break;
00288 
00289         throughput /= probability;
00290 
00291 #ifdef __AO__
00292         /* ambient occlusion */
00293         if(kernel_data.integrator.use_ambient_occlusion) {
00294             /* todo: solve correlation */
00295             float bsdf_u = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_BSDF_U);
00296             float bsdf_v = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_BSDF_V);
00297 
00298             float3 ao_D;
00299             float ao_pdf;
00300 
00301             sample_cos_hemisphere(sd.N, bsdf_u, bsdf_v, &ao_D, &ao_pdf);
00302 
00303             if(dot(sd.Ng, ao_D) > 0.0f && ao_pdf != 0.0f) {
00304                 Ray light_ray;
00305                 float3 ao_shadow;
00306 
00307                 light_ray.P = ray_offset(sd.P, sd.Ng);
00308                 light_ray.D = ao_D;
00309                 light_ray.t = kernel_data.background.ao_distance;
00310 
00311                 if(!shadow_blocked(kg, &state, &light_ray, &ao_shadow)) {
00312                     float3 ao_bsdf = shader_bsdf_diffuse(kg, &sd)*kernel_data.background.ao_factor;
00313                     path_radiance_accum_ao(&L, throughput, ao_bsdf, ao_shadow, state.bounce);
00314                 }
00315             }
00316         }
00317 #endif
00318 
00319 #ifdef __EMISSION__
00320         if(kernel_data.integrator.use_direct_light) {
00321             /* sample illumination from lights to find path contribution */
00322             if(sd.flag & SD_BSDF_HAS_EVAL) {
00323                 float light_t = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_LIGHT);
00324                 float light_o = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_LIGHT_F);
00325                 float light_u = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_LIGHT_U);
00326                 float light_v = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_LIGHT_V);
00327 
00328                 Ray light_ray;
00329                 BsdfEval L_light;
00330                 bool is_lamp;
00331 
00332 #ifdef __MULTI_LIGHT__
00333                 /* index -1 means randomly sample from distribution */
00334                 int i = (kernel_data.integrator.num_distribution)? -1: 0;
00335 
00336                 for(; i < kernel_data.integrator.num_all_lights; i++) {
00337 #else
00338                 const int i = -1;
00339 #endif
00340                     if(direct_emission(kg, &sd, i, light_t, light_o, light_u, light_v, &light_ray, &L_light, &is_lamp)) {
00341                         /* trace shadow ray */
00342                         float3 shadow;
00343 
00344                         if(!shadow_blocked(kg, &state, &light_ray, &shadow)) {
00345                             /* accumulate */
00346                             path_radiance_accum_light(&L, throughput, &L_light, shadow, state.bounce, is_lamp);
00347                         }
00348                     }
00349 #ifdef __MULTI_LIGHT__
00350                 }
00351 #endif
00352             }
00353         }
00354 #endif
00355 
00356         /* no BSDF? we can stop here */
00357         if(!(sd.flag & SD_BSDF))
00358             break;
00359 
00360         /* sample BSDF */
00361         float bsdf_pdf;
00362         BsdfEval bsdf_eval;
00363         float3 bsdf_omega_in;
00364         differential3 bsdf_domega_in;
00365         float bsdf_u = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_BSDF_U);
00366         float bsdf_v = path_rng(kg, rng, sample, rng_offset + PRNG_BSDF_V);
00367         int label;
00368 
00369         label = shader_bsdf_sample(kg, &sd, bsdf_u, bsdf_v, &bsdf_eval,
00370             &bsdf_omega_in, &bsdf_domega_in, &bsdf_pdf);
00371 
00372         shader_release(kg, &sd);
00373 
00374         if(bsdf_pdf == 0.0f || bsdf_eval_is_zero(&bsdf_eval))
00375             break;
00376 
00377         /* modify throughput */
00378         path_radiance_bsdf_bounce(&L, &throughput, &bsdf_eval, bsdf_pdf, state.bounce, label);
00379 
00380         /* set labels */
00381         if(!(label & LABEL_TRANSPARENT))
00382             ray_pdf = bsdf_pdf;
00383 
00384         /* update path state */
00385         path_state_next(kg, &state, label);
00386 
00387         /* setup ray */
00388         ray.P = ray_offset(sd.P, (label & LABEL_TRANSMIT)? -sd.Ng: sd.Ng);
00389         ray.D = bsdf_omega_in;
00390         ray.t = FLT_MAX;
00391 #ifdef __RAY_DIFFERENTIALS__
00392         ray.dP = sd.dP;
00393         ray.dD = bsdf_domega_in;
00394 #endif
00395     }
00396 
00397     float3 L_sum = path_radiance_sum(&L);
00398 
00399 #ifdef __CLAMP_SAMPLE__
00400     path_radiance_clamp(&L, &L_sum, kernel_data.integrator.sample_clamp);
00401 #endif
00402 
00403     kernel_write_light_passes(kg, buffer, &L, sample);
00404 
00405     return make_float4(L_sum.x, L_sum.y, L_sum.z, 1.0f - L_transparent);
00406 }
00407 
00408 __device void kernel_path_trace(KernelGlobals *kg,
00409     __global float *buffer, __global uint *rng_state,
00410     int sample, int x, int y, int offset, int stride)
00411 {
00412     /* buffer offset */
00413     int index = offset + x + y*stride;
00414     int pass_stride = kernel_data.film.pass_stride;
00415 
00416     rng_state += index;
00417     buffer += index*pass_stride;
00418 
00419     /* initialize random numbers */
00420     RNG rng;
00421 
00422     float filter_u;
00423     float filter_v;
00424 
00425     path_rng_init(kg, rng_state, sample, &rng, x, y, &filter_u, &filter_v);
00426 
00427     /* sample camera ray */
00428     Ray ray;
00429 
00430     float lens_u = path_rng(kg, &rng, sample, PRNG_LENS_U);
00431     float lens_v = path_rng(kg, &rng, sample, PRNG_LENS_V);
00432 
00433     camera_sample(kg, x, y, filter_u, filter_v, lens_u, lens_v, &ray);
00434 
00435     /* integrate */
00436     float4 L = kernel_path_integrate(kg, &rng, sample, ray, buffer);
00437 
00438     /* accumulate result in output buffer */
00439     kernel_write_pass_float4(buffer, sample, L);
00440 
00441     path_rng_end(kg, rng_state, rng);
00442 }
